page.title: 10Our schools history
page.content: Our school is called the Stanford School,Laceby and it was founded between the years 1720 and 1730.It was called the Stanford Charity School because money was left in Philip and Sarah Stanford's will to educate the children of Laceby.Sarah and Philip had three children of their own but they all died in infancy.The school opened in 1730 and trustees were appointed to ensure that the money entrusted to the school was used properly.The old log books show how education has changed over the years.The school provided secondary as well as primary education as children left at 14.A new school was built about 15 years ago up the road from the old school.The trustees are still very active.Each year the leavers are presented with a bible or dictionary.
